input_text: Three out of four wars that India and Pakistan have fought since 1947 have been over Kashmir. And the two nuclear powers were again on the cusp of a major confrontation. India and Pakistan each administer a part of Kashmir, but both claim the territory in full. And that’s a problem.

reformatting.result: India Pakistan Kashmir conflict territorial dispute nuclear powers war history

news_query_extraction.result: India-Pakistan wars, Kashmir conflict, nuclear powers, territorial dispute, geopolitical tension

summarization.result:
Here are what other news sources are saying:

1. BBC News covers the longstanding conflict between India and Pakistan over Kashmir, highlighting the diverse opinions within the region regarding its governance. The article delves into the historical context of the conflict, including two wars fought over Kashmir and the nuclear capabilities of both nations.
   Source: [BBC News - Why India and Pakistan fight over Kashmir](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/10537286)

2. Another article from BBC News reports on recent accusations of ceasefire violations between India and Pakistan, following a ceasefire agreement brokered after cross-border attacks. Both countries have accused each other of breaches shortly after agreeing to the ceasefire.
   Source: [BBC News - India and Pakistan accuse each other of 'violations' after ceasefire deal](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cvg9d913v20o)

3. Time magazine discusses the current crisis between India and Pakistan, emphasizing the heightened tensions after a deadly attack in the disputed Kashmir region. The article notes that while a hot war is unlikely, any missteps could potentially escalate the situation.
   Source: [Time - How the India-Pakistan Crisis Could Spiral](https://time.com/7282263/india-pakistan-crisis-pahalgam-attack/)

4. Time also covers the impact of climate change on the water supply in Pakistan, highlighting how tensions with India could worsen the existing crisis. The article mentions Prime Minister Narendra Modi's statement about halting water flow into Pakistan, further straining relations between the two countries.
   Source: [Time - Climate Change Is Straining Pakistan’s Water. Tensions With India Could Make It Worse](https://time.com/7284470/india-pakistan-water-supply-climate-change/)

Here is some relevant discourse on this and related issues on Reddit:

1. A Reddit post on r/news discusses India's reported attack on Pakistani Kashmir, sparking concerns about escalating conflict between the nuclear-armed nations. Comments touch on the potential for wider implications, including involvement of Taliban and China-India tensions.
   Source: [Reddit - India says it attacked Pakistan, Pakistani Kashmir](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/multiple-loud-explosions-heard-pakistani-kashmir-reuters-witness-2025-05-06/)
